intro: Buglossoides arvensis subsp. splitgerberi, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bugloss, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has linear, narrow leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
